content.title: Financial Assistance To Kashmiri Migrants Families Scheme
content.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: Launched on 1st April 2006, the scheme provides financial assistance of ₹1250/- per month per family member for five years to the Kashmiri families which have migrated from Jammu & Kashmir to Haryana and are living in various parts of the State. The financial assistance is subject to a maximum of ₹6,250/- per family.
benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹1,250/- per month per family member for 5 years, subject to a maximum of ₹6,250/- per family per month, provided for re-settlement.
eligibility: The applicant family should have been displaced from Jammu & Kashmir.
The applicant family should have migrated to Haryana from Jammu & Kashmir.
The applicant family should be residing in Haryana.
The annual income of the family, from all sources, should not exceed ₹2,00,000/-.
exclusions: Any sub-division of the family after displacement from Jammu & Kashmir will not be recognized for additional financial assistance.
content.application_process: Offline and Online. Interested applicants should visit the Office/ Sub-Office of the District Social Welfare Officer (DSWO) to request the hard copy of the application form or download it from the official website.
documents_required: Certificate of the Migrated State, issued by the Sub Divisional Official (Civil).
Ration Card, issued by the Food & Supplies Department, Haryana.
Voter ID Card, issued by Election Department, Haryana.
Details of the Saving Bank Account.

faqs.question: What is the “Financial Assistance To Kashmiri Migrants Families” scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, financial assistance will be given to Kashmiri families who have migrated from Jammu & Kashmir to Haryana and are living in various parts of the State.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Social Justice And Empowerment, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: This scheme was launched on 1st April 2006.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Kashmiri families who have migrated from Jammu & Kashmir to Haryana and are living in various parts of the State are eligible to get benefits.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, the financial assistance @ ₹1250/- p.m. per member of the family is subject to a maximum of ₹6250/- per family.

faqs.question: For how long the applicant will get the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The total period of financial assistance for re-settlement will be five years.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion of the scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no age criterion under the scheme.

faqs.question: What does family mean under the scheme?
faqs.answer: ‘Family’ means the family of the applicant at the time of displacement from Kashmir. Any sub-division of the family after displacement from Kashmir will not be recognized for additional financial assistance under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the income criterion under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, the maximum annual income from all sources of the displaced family from Jammu & Kashmir should not exceed ₹2,00,000/-per annum.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible applicant may apply through both online & offline modes.

faqs.question: Where can an applicant find the application form?
faqs.answer: The application form may be downloaded from the official website of the department.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For online application, the applicant should visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
